text: @MikeDiaz285 Thx!

RT @thehill Sen. Ted Cruz: "Pause for a second and imagine how you would feel if Donald J. Trump was doing exactly what Barack Obama and Joe Biden did." http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1268659301415104513/img/jDo2BC583TkrsHBQ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268659301415104513/vid/470x270/QR87sqm8U5SOc99y.mp4?tag=13

Beyond satire.

Yesterday: “It would undermine integrity & independence of NYT if we only published views that editors agreed with”

Today: “We’re sorry we thought integrity was more important than insulating our staff from scary ideas. Won’t happen again” https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/04/business/new-york-times-op-ed-cotton.html

RT @Ami_Magazine Senator @tedcruz in this week’s issue of @Ami_Magazine: “It’s difficult to find an area of policy on which there has been a sharper reversal between the Trump @realDonaldTrump and Obama @POTUS44 administrations than when it comes to our policies towards #Israel.” http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZv8KtbXsAEMfQE.jpg
Today should have been Breonna Taylor’s 27th birthday. But her life was horrifically taken by officers who still have not been charged 84 days later. Keep up the calls for justice. #SayHerName

RT @MondaireJones Growing up poor, black, & gay, I never imagined someone like me could run for Congress. I’m proud to be endorsed by @AOC, who gives hope to so many kids wondering if there is a place for them in a world filled with so much injustice. Will you join us? https://secure.actblue.com/donate/mondaireaoc https://twitter.com/aoc/status/1268903527990124546 QT @AOC .@MondaireJones is a deeply committed fighter for justice.

He‘s a people’s champ rejecting corporate💰 who belongs in Congress representing Rockland & Westchester (where I went to public school!)

Let’s rally around Mondaire. I’m proud to endorse him: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/aoc-mondaire-social

.@MondaireJones is a deeply committed fighter for justice.

He‘s a people’s champ rejecting corporate💰 who belongs in Congress representing Rockland & Westchester (where I went to public school!)

Let’s rally around Mondaire. I’m proud to endorse him: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/aoc-mondaire-social

This is good news for America:
1⃣US gained almost over 2.5 million jobs
2⃣Unemployment dropped to 13.3%
3⃣Labor force participation rate increased to 60.8%

Let’s keep these gains going by continuing to safely re-open our economy and get Americans back to work. https://twitter.com/CNBC/status/1268884554766565376 QT @CNBC BREAKING: The U.S. added 2.5 million jobs in May, with unemployment at 13.3%. https://trib.al/D8hJlco http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZv7xiBXgAAvzh5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268884402697838592/vid/480x270/AEaQm2PWYXiNlLOB.mp4?tag=13

I’m going live on Instagram at 12:30pm ET with @MsPackyetti to honor #BreonnaTaylor’s birthday, lift up local demands, and discuss what systematic changes we can make so no more bright futures are cut short by police. #SayHerName

Finally some positive economic news in the #JobsReport. Forecasters expected 7.5M job losses in May; instead 2.5M jobs were added. 

The role of #PPP in this is beyond dispute. 

It provided a critical lifeline to workers employed by small businesses. #PPPworks

How good and how pleasant it is,when brothers dwell together as one!

Psalms 133:1

40% of households making $40,000 or less have lost their jobs.
 
13% of those making $100,000 or more did.
 
If those numbers were flipped, you can be damn sure Republicans would move mountains to pass emergency relief.

Enough! It’s time to put working families first—not last.

“The only wrong thing to say is to say nothing." Thank you, Meghan, for this powerful statement. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZrTyiQXkAEbmW8.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268558928755003392/vid/320x320/cvezwUnUgvCGlXR3.mp4?tag=13

Last night I joined @stephenathome on the @colbertlateshow to talk about this moment in our country’s history and our path forward to heal as a nation—starting with legislation to fix our broken system of policing. Hope you'll watch: https://www.cbs.com/shows/the-late-show-with-stephen-colbert/video/5URb_Z7f52gJffloTl0MA6_Nj5ymSyPe/sen-cory-booker-talks-race-empathy-and-his-legislation-to-stop-abuses-of-power-by-law-enforcement/

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram was designed to provide immediate relief to the small businesses hurting as a result of the #CoronavirusPandemic. And the #PPP has done just that by delivering more than half a trillion dollars & saving millions of American jobs. #SmallBizRelief http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1268929500315877376/img/Bpzhm_hePmo3Pm5m.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268929500315877376/vid/540x270/Nzv4chyqsK_aivVi.mp4?tag=13

This is what unfettered capitalism looks like. Workers have the "choice" of going back to work in unsafe conditions, or going hungry. In the wealthiest country on Earth, we can do better than that. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/04/us/virus-unemployment-fired.html?referringSource=articleShare

RT @nowthisnews Washington, D.C., officials painted ‘BLACK LIVES MATTER’ in 35-foot-tall letters on the street just blocks from the White House http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1268926475287363586/img/bUauJO0d5UYxbZmF.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268926475287363586/vid/320x320/CsIGudzKVy4C7O_q.mp4?tag=13

The @StateDept hasn't processed Americans’ applications for passports or renewal of passports since mid-March, resulting in a massive backlog of 1.6 million applications. My colleagues and I urge @SecPompeo to expedite the processing of these applications. https://www.romney.senate.gov/romney-urges-state-department-expedite-massive-passport-application-backlog

Great news for #SmallBiz! @realDonaldTrump just signed bipartisan legislation Congress passed this week to extend and provide flexibility for #PPP, helping even more job creators hire back their employees & open up their doors again.
https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/05/coronavirus-relief-trump-signs-bill-to-ease-limits-on-small-business-loans.html?__source=sharebar|twitter&par=sharebar

Know your power: Your engagement and organizing today are more important than ever before – making a difference during the #coronavirus crisis.

We must strengthen our House Democratic Majority, take back the Senate and vote out the current occupant of the White House.

RT @vladduthiersCBS I had to clip this because it is unbelievable. President @realDonaldTrump just said this: “Hopefully, George is looking down right and saying this is a great thing that’s happening for our country. It’s a great day for him, it’s a great day for everybody.” #GeorgeFloyd http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268920195222994945/pu/img/3cmIvw84XhomvlLy.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268920195222994945/pu/vid/480x270/3I9rgQI2UIO9CtdE.mp4?tag=10

RT @SmallBizCmte Chairman Rubio on May #JobsReport #PPPWorks

“While far too many Americans remain out of work, it is clear the economic situation for tens of millions of workers and millions of small businesses would be far worse without the Paycheck Protection Program."
https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=Press-Releases&id=8E0FE563-81AD-4BFD-A687-5FB54F13C903
#PPPworks http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268949180699021319/pu/img/kIYwPGTgHXwfpMOt.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268949180699021319/pu/vid/466x270/0NgSP3LbfatMMyOr.mp4?tag=10
Read my full statement here: https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/6520

May’s #JobsReport shows that decisive Congressional action can make a difference in our economy. But as coronavirus continues to spread w/o adequate testing & tracing, this is the worst possible time to take our foot off the gas. The Senate must quickly pass the #HeroesAct.

Keith Nielsen should resign.

Dammit, stop it. Stop saying stupid, racist things. Our country is grieving.

Let’s come together for equal justice under law. Let’s unite behind Dr. King’s powerful dream, where all of us are judged, not by race, but by the content of our character.

Disgraceful that Trump is celebrating 13.3% unemployment during the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression and a pandemic with no end in sight.

My bill would provide $2,000 monthly payments to get people through this pandemic—and for 3 months after.

Thank you to @AEI’s @marcthiessen & @dpletka for inviting me to join y’all on @AEI_WTHIGO. Take a listen to our wide-ranging conversation on #GeorgeFloyd, the threat of the Chinese Communist Party, the catastrophic Obama-Iran nuclear deal & more 👇

RT @Blklivesmatter Happy 27th birthday, Breonna. We honor you today and always. Rest, now. #BreonnaTaylor #BlackLivesMatter #RestInPower http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268906351364800513/pu/img/zLDVj9uRLS3PtZ1X.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268906351364800513/pu/vid/480x270/DeiUVnBIbCjB0MqM.mp4?tag=10

Racial injustice goes far beyond police brutality. Black families have 1/10th the wealth of white families, over half of Black workers earn less than $15/hour, and Black families are much less likely to have decent health insurance. The fight for justice continues on all fronts.

RT @realDonaldTrump I just signed the Paycheck Protection Program Flexibility Act to further improve our VERY POPULAR AND SUCCESSFUL program to help small businesses. THANK YOU to our GREAT REPUBLICAN SENATORS! @senatemajldr @marcorubio @SenatorCollins @SteveDaines @SenThomTillis @SenCoryGardner http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZw-bMeU0AIkwM4.jpg

Very encouraging to see POTUS stand up for US investors. Chinese companies flaunt our rules while listing on US stock exchanges & soliciting American capital. Working group should adopt the policies in my EQUITABLE Act & protect Americans from fraud. https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/memorandum-protecting-united-states-investors-significant-risks-chinese-companies/
Today would've been Breonna Taylor's 27th birthday. Her life was tragically taken by police and we will not stop marching for justice until it’s served for her and her family. #SayHerName
Real men wear masks. #FamiliesFirst @MadMoneyOnCNBC http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZtim_YWkAcPlJT.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268714100374323200/vid/480x270/Hl989pX8dAtNE86A.mp4?tag=13

Breonna Taylor should still be alive and celebrating her 27th birthday today.

We must demand #JusticeForBre. Text ENOUGH to 55156. https://twitter.com/ColorOfChange/status/1268887356377116672 QT @ColorOfChange #SayHerName #BreonnaTaylor should be turning 27. An essential worker who wasn't treated essential by police who murdered her. We can’t talk about police brutality w/o talking about countless Black women who are killed & often forgotten. Demand #JusticeForBre. Text ENOUGH to 55156 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZv-UszXYAEEdYV.jpg

Breonna Taylor should be alive today, celebrating her 27th birthday with family and friends. Instead, she was shot in her own home on March 13 by police officers who still haven’t been arrested. We need #JusticeforBreonna.

White Americans need to be active, anti-racist allies—in this moment and beyond. Breonna Taylor should still be with us today celebrating her 27th birthday—but she was killed by police officers who still have not been charged after nearly 3 months. We demand justice. #SayHerName

RT @SmallBizCmte President Trump has signed the #PaycheckProtectionProgram Flexibility Act.

This will allow #smallbiz leeway to use their funds while ensuring workers paychecks are protected. #PPPworks
.@FEMA has announced it will reimburse @BOCCPIO more than $1.1 million to restore county roadway signs damaged as a result of #HurricaneMichael.
.@FEMA has announced it will reimburse the @CityofLynnHaven more than $1.1 million to repair damages to the Old Bailey Bridge as a result of #HurricaneMichael.
.@FEMA has announced it will reimburse @CityofMiami than $1.6 million for emergency protective measures as a result of #HurricaneIrma.

Trump said today the economy is "taking off like a rocket ship." Really? Real unemployment is 21.2%. 32.5 million are out of work. Youth unemployment is 29.9%. 1 in 4 Americans are skipping meals.

The president is completely out of touch with reality.

RT @JessicaLBYRD Thinking of Breonna & all the Black women I’ve loved on their birthday. 

I can imagine the 27 balloons and the flowers and fresh outfit and zoom party with her favorite drink. You deserved to celebrate today. 

We promise that we will sing about you. 💜 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZwbSwuXgAE5Ex9.jpg

.@dcexaminer: 'Grossly negligent': Sen. Cruz grills Rod Rosenstein over handling of Mueller investigation and FBI warrants  https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/grossly-negligent-ted-cruz-grills-rod-rosenstein-over-handling-of-mueller-investigation-and-fbi-warrants

There is no one-and-done solution to the systemic racism deeply embedded in our policing and our criminal justice system. But it’s clear that Donald Trump won’t hold police departments accountable—so Congress needs to step up now.

I’m introducing legislation to reverse the Trump administration’s limits on the use of consent decrees, empower state AGs to pursue their own investigations into discriminatory policing, and triple funding for DOJ’s Civil Rights Division so they can pursue these cases.

We need systemic reform to address police brutality. But the federal government does have the power to investigate police departments with a history of discriminatory policing—a power that former AG Jeff Sessions severely constrained. Here's how we change that:

I'm very proud of the people standing up for justice and taking to the streets. When we study history we look at pivotal moments — the Civil War, the Great Depression, World War II. People will look back on this time as one of those moments. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZxdorFXkAAh9TX.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268939248360738817/vid/320x320/Bq8OGNGGEpKpPHqe.mp4?tag=13

Lynching isn’t just a part of our past. Ahmaud Arbery was murdered just 3 months ago. And Senator @RandPaul is blocking our bill to make lynching a federal crime. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZxdoeLWoAIPnAs.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268991563574710273/vid/320x320/_nG_0BU8wNep15gT.mp4?tag=13

Hadiya Pendleton was 15-years-old when she was shot and killed in Chicago. Today we #WearOrange to honor her life and all those we’ve lost to gun violence. I won’t stop fighting until we create a future free from these tragedies.

.@BreitbartNews: Sen. Cruz: Obama, Biden ‘Much, Much Worse‘ Than ‘Everything Richard Nixon Did‘ https://www.breitbart.com/clips/2020/06/03/cruz-obama-biden-much-much-worse-than-everything-richard-nixon-did/

Wow.

This is a courageous example of the kind of material actions and commitments allies can make - shout out for walking the walk, @alexisohanian. https://twitter.com/alexisohanian/status/1268943036228292608 QT @alexisohanian I've resigned as a member of the reddit board, I have urged them to fill my seat with a black candidate, + I will use future gains on my Reddit stock to serve the black community, chiefly to curb racial hate, and I’m starting with a pledge of $1M to @kaepernick7’s @yourrightscamp

RT @CoryBooker I've stood alongside @KamalaHarris in attempt after attempt to finally pass anti-lynching legislation. On the day of George Floyd's memorial, today would've been a symbolic day to come together and do it.

But one person stands in the way. https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/04/rand-paul-anti-lynching-bill-301617

Breonna Taylor should be celebrating her 27th birthday today. The police officers who shot her to death in her own home on March 13 have walked free.

Today we #SayHerName and we fight for justice. https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/05/us/breonna-taylor-birthday-charges-arrests-case-trnd/index.html

Today, we #WearOrange to remember the beautiful souls we have lost to gun violence and as a sign of our commitment to ending the suffering that violence brings to communities nationwide. By making our voices heard & working together, we can achieve life-saving progress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZxtb39XkAES_Xd.jpg

RT @rashadrobinson George Floyd changed the world. We honor his memory by continuing to fight against police brutality until we change the rules of the systems that suffocate us. #RestInPower https://twitter.com/CNN/status/1268634733220524032 QT @CNN "George Floyd's story has been the story of black folks," says Rev. Al Sharpton during his eulogy.

"The reason we could never be who we wanted and dreamed of being is you kept your knee on our neck... Like George, we couldn't breathe... You wouldn't take your knee off our neck." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZsTpazXsAsdAJ4.png https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268626942863040516/vid/480x270/vulKtU73fBsNqi49.mp4?tag=13

Black & Brown families bear the brunt of the gun violence epidemic. Many of the names of people we’ve lost never make it onto the news. Too many die at the hands of police. This #WearOrange Day we recognize that to #EndGunViolence we must fight the systemic racism in our country. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZxhNHjWAAAj7Ci.jpg

America is on the road to recovery. Together we will get our economy back on its feet and Americans back to work. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1268997385910394882 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1269011601304227840/pu/img/X8M8I7JyVBGaLk1_.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1269011601304227840/pu/vid/480x270/TXPS7xlgllkOO0vg.mp4?tag=10 QT @washingtonpost Dow soars more than 800 points as U.S. stocks close in on pre-pandemic levels https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/06/05/stocks-market-today-coronavirus-economy/

I believe there is a better future for our country—and it starts by working to #TurnTexasBlue. 

And after speaking at the @TexasDemocrats convention today, I believe in their extraordinary power. Chip in $38 now for their 38 electoral votes: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/tdp-ci?refcode=Harris

RT @ajplus Today is #BreonnaTaylor's birthday. She would be 27.

In March, police killed her when they stormed her home while she was sleeping, looking for a man who did not live there.

84 days later, no officers have been charged. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZv21e5WkAAkz4m.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZv2zM9WoAUybf9.jpg

There’s no substitute for personal experience. https://twitter.com/msnbcpr/status/1269006499789049856 QT @MSNBCPR JUST ANNOUNCED: @MSNBC welcomes Former FBI Lawyer @NatSecLisa as an NBC News & MSNBC National Security & Legal Analyst. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZxqroVX0AUQ1j0.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1269006439621763074/vid/480x270/Gto9zp25LtCKkaX1.mp4?tag=13

On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, we honor the victims of gun violence in America—the 100 people killed by guns every day & the 100,000 shot every year in our country. This national tragedy, one that disproportionally hurts our Black communities, is one we can & must fix.
RT @johnlegend Happy birthday to Breonna Taylor https://ew.com/news/john-legend-breonna-taylor-op-ed/?amp=true&__twitter_impression=true

We need a national standard on the use of force by police.
We need independent investigations into police misconduct and officer-involved killings.
We need real police accountability. https://twitter.com/Cosmopolitan/status/1268596775667015681 QT @Cosmopolitan .@SenKamalaHarris explains why she protests in solidarity with Black Lives Matter and how she’s making change happen. 
http://www.cosmopolitan.com/politics/a32766156/kamala-harris-black-lives-matter-protests/

Every day, they make Texas proud. Every day, they are fighting to meet the needs of their communities – and to build a brighter future for hard-working families. -NP

Lizzie Fletcher – a bold, independent voice on the Transportation & Infrastructure and Science, Space & Technology Committees;

Collin Allred – fighting for to lower health care costs and a leader in the Foreign, Veterans and Transportation Committees.

Sylvia Garcia, a leader in the Judiciary and Financial Services committees.

Lloyd Doggett, a champion for lowering prescription drug costs in the Ways & Means Committee

Filemon Vela, a compassionate advocate for our farmers and men and women in uniform serving in the Agriculture and Armed Services committees.

Vicente Gonzalez, a leader in the Foreign Affairs and Financial Services committees.

Sheila Jackson Lee, a passionate fighter serving on the Budget, Homeland Security and Judiciary committees. 

Marc Veasey, a thoughtful leader on the Energy & Commerce and Small Business committees.

Al Green, a respected leader for Texas on the Homeland Security and Financial Services committees.

Veronica Escobar, a tireless advocate for gun violence prevention who sits on the Armed Services and Judiciary committees.

Joaquin Castro, a strong leader in the Intelligence Committee, fighting to protect our national security.  

Henry Cuellar, a principled fighter for working families serving on the Appropriations Committee.

Their legacy is carried forward in the leadership of the extraordinary men and women Texas Democrats have sent to the Congress now, including: 

Chairwoman Eddie Bernice Johnson, leading the Space, Science & Technology Committee.
